children.text: Why Enhance Your Indoor Air Quality

When you think about air pollution, you probably think about outdoor air quality. Bad outdoor air can add up bad effects to your health and home convenience, while your indoor air quality can be four times more dangerous than what is outside, with no proper air quality system. It is due to the heavy insulation and heat sealing during the construction of a new building, designed to keep your HVAC system working efficiently. While this is excellent for your air conditioner and heating system, it doesn’t let indoor particles and pollutants to escape. There are several sources in your home that can lead to poor indoor air quality: cleaning products, pesticides, smoke, aerosols, and more.
Risks of Poor Indoor Air Quality
The risks of living with poor home indoor air quality add more common illnesses, getting asthma, and intensified allergy manifestations.

If you think about it, you will suddenly realize that a big part of your time daily is spent at your house. It could be relaxing, taking naps, holding festive parties, and even sleeping. The big question is, are you sure that the air you are inhaling at home is free of dangerous contaminants?

The poor indoor air quality will lead to SBS (sick building syndrome). Health-related signs that take place as a result of poor indoor air quality. People who have asthma or any respiratory diseases will experience bigger health issues soon. It is until you get the professionals to conduct some services for indoor air quality at your home.

Our HVAC specialists have delivered quality, temperature-controlled air to homes everywhere in the DFW area, since 1953. At Dring, we have set and maintained our professional reputation through our sincerest efforts and excellent service. Our team is always able to serve you in the most professional and efficient way possible.
Advantages of Indoor Air Quality Solutions
Keeping clean air in your home is equal to having a happy and healthy family. There are many benefits of scheduling an IAQ consultation with Dring Air Conditioning and Heating, such as:
Minimized odors

– Poor airflow and filtration can lead to bad smells to live and grow in some indoor areas such as basements. Areas, where odors stay in, are commonly damp and dark, making them the ideal spots for molds to grow. Changes to indoor air quality won’t just lessen smells in those areas — the whole indoor space can benefit, too!
Enhanced health
– With air quality solutions, you can determine the factors that are negatively affecting the health of you and your family.
Increased home value

– Do you plan on selling your home in the future? Because your house smells great, clients will enter your home and smell a fresh, clean environment. It will help possible buyers envision themselves in your home.
Reap the advantages of better indoor air quality in your home! Call us today to schedule your appointment for a home air quality consultation!
What Are Your Air Quality System Options?
When deciding an air quality system for your home, you will want to consider your convenience and the health of your loved ones. We provide a variety of indoor air quality products and services:
Humidifiers
– It is to control the amount of humidity in your home. Dring technicians can install fan-powered or bypass types with water vapor removal capacities up to 25 gallons.
HVAC filters
– It is to collect foreign air particles. Dring offers a variety of sizes and types like mechanical add-on furnace filters, expandable mechanical filters, and electronic air filters.
HVAC ventilators
– It brings fresh air into your home while dismissing stale unhealthy air.
HVAC maintenance

– It is the most significant solution you can do to enhance indoor air quality and give your family a clean-living environment. In addition to scheduling annual maintenance service, we suggest replacing your filters every month from May to October, and every other month from November to April.

Dring provides maintenance to all of the DFW areas like Farmers Branch, Grapevine, Plano, Richardson, McKinney, Irving, and Coppell, Texas. To schedule a service visit, give us a call today or contact us via our website.
